Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Suecia”
Reviews.Author: Torero
Reviews.Content: For 20 years the SUECIA was my hotel when I stayed in MADRID. I travelled to MADRID 3 to 4 times a year and spent about one month in all per year. The owners have decided to sell the Hotel instead of investing for necessary upgrades regarding current regulations. It will be transformed into Apartments. For those of you who knew this Hotel ( Hemingway stayed here when he came to the Bullfights and to the Circulo de Bellas Artes in the 1950's ) you will understand if I say this Hotel had a wonderful location for a good price. Clients of the Hotel were asked to leave about two weeks ago. I had reservations for 11 days starting June 1st. My thoughts go to my friends from the Hotel Staff who are out of a job, Gracia, Daniel, Juan Pablo, Paco, Antonio. I will miss you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked via Octopustravel and spent 4 nights in this Hotel. The staff was very kind and the lodge with the bar was really nice. Unfortunately the rooms were disappointing if compared with the price we paid: a bit small and not that nice looking we saw in the site pictures. Breakfast was good and the location was excellent: close to the Banco De Espana underground station, the Prado and Sol. A few minutes walk and you get everywhere in Madrid. Everything with Suecia is good except for the price you pay compared to the room you get. Would not return again (unless I find a special discount *grin*)

Reviews.Title: “staff much nicer now”
Reviews.Author: austindude
Reviews.Content: Our client booked this hotel for us -- reading the other comments, I was a bit bummed to learn I would be staying at a hotel w/such rude staff. From my experience, it seems like management got the message. Their website hotelsuecia shows their slogan 'we just want to be the nicest' which I'm guessing is in response to a reputation of being rude. This is the only explanation I can thing of, because I have to say that the staff was not only not rude, they bent over backwards to help me. I've loved the experience here. The location is awesome. My only (minor) issue is that you have to pay for wireless access, and it can be a bit flaky. I'm working with someone at a different hotel, and they said theirs was worse. Plus I've had the same issue w/some hotels in the states.I'm writing this review from the hotel using the wireless access now-- I'm on the 3rd floor, and the signal's a bit weak from my room, so I've had to work in the hallway. They have an outlet and tables in the hall, though, so it's only a minor incovenience. Getting back to the staff, they were extremely friendly and helpful. They let me check in early after a long flight from the States. The maids greeted me when I arrived. The staff lent me a transformer for my laptop. They outsource their wireless support-- when it was down, they had me speak to whoever does their support (the staff and the support speak Spanish and English), but I was eventually up and running, and they were very helpful. I'd be curious what other more recent travelers think, but to me the staff has not been rude at all -- on the contrary, very impressive. I think they've changed their tune

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this Hotel in late Jan '05. The Suecia is in a good location with a fairly good restaurant.. Our room on the 9th floor although , of good size, & clean was badly in need of a refurbishing. Stains on carpet, soiled walls, cigarette burn on bed-spread and worn ,water strained desk all needed attention. Biggest complaint of all was the rudest, most impatience, Reception Desk staff-person I have ever encountered in my 55+ years of travel. At check-in I literally had to stand there and demand his attention to receive some service!!!!!. If I would have not have had an appointment scheduled in less than an hour I would have very quickly found another hotel.. Overall our stay here was O.K. and the Hotel is not that bad, but I will stay elsewhere when next visiting Madrid. .

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: carcinoid
Reviews.Content: Good central location for walking almost anywhere to see sites. The room was adequate and clean. We didn't spend much time in our room, so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Suecia, Extremely Friendly/Hefpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: HOTRAM
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suecia had a very friendly and helpful staff. The room was clearn; however, not the best room view. The location was excellent, quite surroundings, yet convenient to various tourist sites. Overall, for the price it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in a side street just up the road from the art galleries. Otherwise very disappointing. Tacky furnishings that made me heave, doors that needed slamming to stay shut (judging by the noise from elsewhere, other people had this problem), and paper-thin walls so that I could follow my neighbour-from-hell's personal life (loud music at 6.30am, loud t.v. at midnight) in minute detail. Madrid worth visiting a hundred times, this place never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice room but some staff displayed bad attitude to the edge of insulting.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying at this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Suecia and its staff make staying here a special joy for those who are in Madrid to enjoy the arts. This moderately priced hotel is right next door to the trendy and sophisticated Circulo des Bellas Artes, but more importantly, it is within easy walking distance of all the great museums and theaters. All of the rooms are quiet with 50s/60s decor. (A few of the rooms are as dark as the vault of a Swiss bank, although they are comfortably large.) Non-smoking rooms and extra long beds are available. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful with maps, restaurant reservations and hailing cabs. Breakfast is varied, fresh and generous. I've stayed there three times and like to think of it as my "own" place in Madrid. Try the Bocaito tapas restaurant not far away!

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Art Lovers will enjoy this small hotel for its great location, just minutes from Prado, Thyssen, Accademia. Nice bar and restaurant. Rooms were light, clean and nicely appointed. This is on a very quiet block, with our room overlooking a private garden across the street. Staff was pleasant, unobtrusive.
